data.title: Vera Brittain fonds

Double quotation marks are used to signify the author's own title on the folder in which the material was located, and single quotation marks indicate the author's title to the individual page titles within that folder.

Under the heading Research Material, materials (i.e. newspaper clippings, magazine articles and pamphlets) that the author consulted and frequently used in the writing of the book are listed. The published versions of the books that are listed are the particular editions that are in this archive, which often include translations of the book. The use of square brackets indicates either the approximate date of the manuscript if it is not known, or our own description of the material.

MAJOR UNPUBLISHED MANUSCRIPTS

The subsequent section lists the unpublished manuscripts of this collection. Each manuscript is described and appears in chronological order.

Box 43

A27. THE PAWN OF FATE; a novel

[Written 1918].

Mottled green paper cover with cloth spine.

[178 p], holograph notebook.

"Preface: In the small sketch of life in a military hospital in France which serves as part of the background to the heroine of this story, many will probably think that they recognise themselves. It is a well-known fact that in the medical and nursing professions a conformity to type exists which is equalled by that of no other vocation in life. Active service conditions tend to emphasize rather than detract from this conformity. For the majority of readers this explanation will doubtless be sufficient. For the rest, I can only say, that if any feel the cap fits, by all means let them wear it."

A28. FOLLY'S VINEYARD, a novel. [Title changed from The Pawn Of Fate].

[1918]

[191 p], annotated carbon-typescript.

Includes eight [8], loose sheets of rough summaries of the Prologue, chapter summaries and the Introduction.

A29. A CHRONICLE OF YOUTH

[1924]

[546 p], annotated typescript.

"(Typescript. Predecessor to Testament of Youth.) Consists of extracts from my 1913-1916 diaries (with names changed), submitted for an autobiography competition about 1924, which it did not win. Naive, amusing, pathetic; hence worth keeping, and possibly, when far enough back in history, worth publishing." Vera Brittain.

An Extract from the Foreword:

"Until a very few months ago, no eyes but my own had seen the diary which is here reproduced, and even my own had not seen it for several years. These intimate, undisciplined outpourings were forced from my immaturity by the urgent need of self-expression. I have decided to publish them now because I have come to believe that our need for understanding, one of another, is at least equally urgent."

The albums contain contain newspaper and magazine cuttings of reviews, announcements and special features of her life as both lecturer and author. The articles from American, Canadian and English newspapers document her lecture tours in Europe and North America, and reveal the reaction of the reading public to her novels. They are listed chronologically, giving the title of the album with a brief description of the contents.

Note: Any statement in double quotation marks indicates the author's own title or thoughts.

Box 57a

E1. "Testament Of Youth. From April 1933. England." Light-blue canvas cloth album. [160 p.]. [April 1933-September 1960].

This album covers the novel, Testament of Youth. An Autobiographical Story Of The Years 1900-1925.

Contents: preliminary notices of the novel, advertisements, reviews, book lists.

E2. "Testament Of Youth. Foreign." Light-blue canvas cloth album. [160 p.]. [May 1933-May 1936].

Contents: reviews, articles from Canadian, American and other foreign countries' newspapers, and brief correspondence from publishers; two envelopes containing loose cuttings.

E3. "Honourable Estate. (American Press)." Brown canvas cloth-covered album. [160 p.]. [June 1936-December 1936].

Contents: reviews and booklists from American newspapers; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

Box 57b

E4. "Honourable Estate. (English)." Brown canvas cloth-covered album. [160 p.]. [May 1935-February 1937].

Contents: reviews and booklists from English newspapers; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

E5. "Thrice A Stranger. (English and Colonial)." Green canvas cloth-covered album. [160 p.]. [August 1938-March 1939].

Contents: reviews on the book from English and Canadian newspapers; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

E6. "Thrice A Stranger. American." Green canvas cloth-covered album. [160 p.]. [August 1938-October 1938].

Contents: reviews and booklists on the book from American newspapers; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

Box 58

E7. "Testament Of Friendship. English." Blue canvas cloth-covered album. [160 p.]. [September 1933-May 1940].

Contents: reviews and booklists; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

Contents: reviews and booklists from Canadian newspapers; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

Box 59

E9. "Testament Of Friendship. American." Blue canvas cloth-covered album. [160 p.] November 1939-April 1940.

Contents: reviews and booklists from American newspapers; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

E10. "England's Hour. (America & Dominions)." Dark-brown canvas cloth-covered album. [160 p.]. [November 1940-July 1941].

Contents: reviews on the book from American and Canadian newspapers; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

Box 60a

E11. "England's Hour. (England)." Humiliation With Honour.

Account Rendered. England and American. Dark-brown canvas cloth-covered album. [160 p]. [January 1941-December 1945].

Contents: reviews and correspondence (fan-mail) relating to the three books from American, Canadian and English newspapers; one envelope containing loose cuttings.

E12. "Testament of Experience. U.S.A. and Commonwealth." Dark blue vinyl-covered album. [36 p.]. [January 1957-1961].

Contents: reviews, advance news cuttings on the book and fan-mail regarding this book.

E13. "The Women At Oxford." Green vinyl covered album. [36 p.] [December 1959-July 1960].

Contents: reviews of the book.

E14. "Selected Letters. Winifred Holtby and Vera Brittain. 1960-1961." Blue canvas cloth-covered album. [32 p.] [September 1959-December 1961].

Contents: reviews and correspondence regarding this book.

Contents: One envelope containing loose cuttings.

Contents: newspaper articles pertaining to her lecture engagements in America at this time.

India. January 1963. (Madras, New Delhi, Benares, Calcutta, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Taipeh, Bombay.)

E36. Cloth bound embroidered with three red flowers. [100 p.]. 1891-1936. Contains clippings for a variety of events including births, deaths, and memorials for family and friends; also an invitation to wedding of Vera and George Catlin. Contains clippings about and reviews of Vera's writings. Contains handwritten notes by Vera, one has been pasted into the album.
